data.title: Fitch report on Mexico shows government doing well, president says
data.meta_description: Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said on Thursday that credit rating agency Fitch's latest report on Mexico, which confirmed the country's current rating, showed his government is doing a good job managing its public finances. On Wednesday, Fitch confirmed the sovereign rating of Latin America's second-largest economy at BBB-, one notch above speculative grade, or junk, with a stable outlook.
data.text:
MEXICO CITY, Nov 12 (Reuters) - Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said on Thursday that credit rating agency Fitch's latest report on Mexico, which confirmed the country's current rating, showed his government is doing a good job managing its public finances.

On Wednesday, Fitch confirmed the sovereign rating of Latin America's second-largest economy at BBB-, one notch above speculative grade, or junk, with a stable outlook. (Reporting by Ana Isabel Martinez, writing by Laura Gottesdiener)
